            class UniqueUploadsValidator < ActiveModel::EachValidator
          
      3. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    3. 
            
            

            

                def validate_each(record, attribute, value)
          
      4. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    4. 
            
            

            

                  value.each do |upload|
          
      5. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    5. 
            
            

            

                    if record.class.joins("INNER JOIN active_storage_attachments AS att ON att.record_type = '#{record.class}' AND att.record_id = #{record.class.table_name}.id")
          
      6. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    6. 
            
            

            

                                 .joins("INNER JOIN active_storage_blobs AS blobs ON blobs.id = att.blob_id")
          
      7. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    7. 
            
            

            

                                 .where.not("att.name = ?", upload.name)
          
      8. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    8. 
            
            

            

                                 .where(blobs: { filename: upload.filename.to_s, checksum: upload.blob.checksum })
          
      9. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    9. 
            
            

            

                                 .count > 0
          
      10. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    10. 
            
            

            

                      record.errors.add(attribute, "El archivo #{upload.blob.filename.to_s} ya ha sido subido.")
          
      11. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    11. 
            
            

            

                    end 
          
      12. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    12. 
            
            

            

                  end 
          
      13. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    13. 
            
            

            

                end 
          
      14. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    14. 
            
            

            

              end

                #spaces. One digit is the width of one "module" or X dimension.
          
      41.

      43.

                def method_missing(name, *args, &b)#:nodoc:
          
      67. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    67. 
            
            

            

                  #See if an outputter has registered this method
          
      68. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    68. 
            
            

            

                  if self.class.outputters.include?(name)
          
      69. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    69. 
            
            

            

                    klass, method_name = self.class.outputters[name]
          
      70. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    70. 
            
            

            

                    klass.new(self).send(method_name, *args, &b)
          
      71. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    71. 
            
            

            

                  else
          
      72. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    72. 
            
            

            

                    super
          
      73. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    73. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      74. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    74. 
            
            

            

                end

                  # Non-digit characters like hyphens and spaces are ignored.

                  def isbn=(isbn)

                    if match = PATTERN.match(isbn.gsub(/\D/, ''))
          
      65.

                      @number = match[:number]

                  def digits

                    (prefix+number).split('').map(&:to_i)

                  def isbn_10_digits
          
      106. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    106. 
            
            

            

                    number.split('').map(&:to_i)
          
      107. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    107. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      108.

    109. 
            
            

            

            
          
      110. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    110. 
            
            

            

                  # Calculates the ISBN 13-digit checksum following the algorithm from:
          
      111. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    111. 
            
            

            

                  # http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/International_Standard_Book_Number#ISBN-13_check_digit_calculation
          
      112. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    112. 
            
            

            

                  def checksum
          
      113. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    113. 
            
            

            

                    (10 - (digits.each_with_index.inject(0) do |sum, (digit, index)|
          
      114. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    114. 
            
            

            

                      sum + (digit * (index.even? ? 1 : 3))
          
      115. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    115. 
            
            

            

                    end % 10)) % 10
          
      116. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    116. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      117. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    117. 
            
            

            

            
          
      118. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    118. 
            
            

            

            
          
      119. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    119. 
            
            

            

                  ISBN_10_CHECKSUM_MULTIPLIERS = [10,9,8,7,6,5,4,3,2]
          
      120. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    120. 
            
            

            

            
          
      121. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    121. 
            
            

            

                  # Calculates the ISBN 10-digit checksum following the algorithm from:
          
      122. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    122. 
            
            

            

                  # http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/International_Standard_Book_Number#ISBN-10_check_digit_calculation
          
      123. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    123. 
            
            

            

                  def isbn_10_checksum
          
      124. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    124. 
            
            

            

                    isbn_10_digits.zip(ISBN_10_CHECKSUM_MULTIPLIERS).inject(0) do |sum, (digit, multiplier)|
          
      125. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    125. 
            
            

            

                      sum + (digit * multiplier)
          
      126. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    126. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      127. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    127. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      128. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    128. 
            
            

            

            
          
      129. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    129. 
            
            

            

            
          
      130. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    130. 
            
            

            

                  def to_s
          
      131. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    131. 
            
            

            

                    isbn_with_checksum
          
      132. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    132. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      133. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    133. 
            
            

            

            
          
      134. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    134. 
            
            

            

                  def inspect
          
      135. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    135. 
            
            

            

                    "#<#{self.class}:0x#{'%014x' % object_id} #{formatted_isbn}>"
          
      136. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    136. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      137. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    137. 
            
            

            

            
          
      138. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    138. 
            
            

            

            
          
      139. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    139. 
            
            

            

                end#class ISBN
          
      140.

      142.

              end#class Bookland

      144.

            end#module Barby

    lib/barby/barcode/codabar.rb

    0.0% lines covered

    1. 
            
            

            

            require "barby/barcode"
          
      2. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    2. 
            
            

            

            
          
      3. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    3. 
            
            

            

            module Barby
          
      4. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    4. 
            
            

            

              # https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Codabar
          
      5. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    5. 
            
            

            

              class Codabar < Barcode1D
          
      6. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    6. 
            
            

            

                BLACK_NARROW_WIDTH = 1
          
      7. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    7. 
            
            

            

                WHITE_NARROW_WIDTH = 2
          
      8. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    8. 
            
            

            

                WIDE_WIDTH_RATE = 3
          
      9. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    9. 
            
            

            

                SPACING = 5 # must be equal to or wider than white narrow width
          
      10. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    10. 
            
            

            

                CHARACTERS = "0123456789-$:/.+ABCD".freeze
          
      11. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    11. 
            
            

            

                # even: black, odd: white
          
      12. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    12. 
            
            

            

                # 0: narrow, 1: wide
          
      13. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    13. 
            
            

            

                BINARY_EXPRESSION = [
          
      14. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    14. 
            
            

            

                  "0000011", # 0
          
      15. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    15. 
            
            

            

                  "0000110", # 1
          
      16. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    16. 
            
            

            

                  "0001001", # 2
          
      17. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    17. 
            
            

            

                  "1100000", # 3
          
      18. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    18. 
            
            

            

                  "0010010", # 4
          
      19. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    19. 
            
            

            

                  "1000010", # 5
          
      20. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    20. 
            
            

            

                  "0100001", # 6
          
      21. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    21. 
            
            

            

                  "0100100", # 7
          
      22. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    22. 
            
            

            

                  "0110000", # 8
          
      23. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    23. 
            
            

            

                  "1001000", # 9
          
      24. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    24. 
            
            

            

                  "0001100", # -
          
      25. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    25. 
            
            

            

                  "0011000", # $
          
      26. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    26. 
            
            

            

                  "1000101", # :
          
      27. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    27. 
            
            

            

                  "1010001", # /
          
      28. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    28. 
            
            

            

                  "1010100", # .
          
      29. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    29. 
            
            

            

                  "0010101", # +
          
      30. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    30. 
            
            

            

                  "0011010", # A
          
      31. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    31. 
            
            

            

                  "0101001", # B
          
      32. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    32. 
            
            

            

                  "0001011", # C
          
      33. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    33. 
            
            

            

                  "0001110", # D
          
      34. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    34. 
            
            

            

                ].each(&:freeze)
          
      35. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    35. 
            
            

            

                CHARACTER_TO_BINARY = Hash[CHARACTERS.chars.zip(BINARY_EXPRESSION)].freeze
          
      36. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    36. 
            
            

            

                FORMAT = /\A[ABCD][0123456789\-\$:\/\.\+]+[ABCD]\z/.freeze
          
      37. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    37. 
            
            

            

                ONE = "1".freeze
          
      38. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    38. 
            
            

            

                ZERO = "0".freeze
          
      39. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    39. 
            
            

            

            
          
      40. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    40. 
            
            

            

                attr_accessor :data, :black_narrow_width, :white_narrow_width, :wide_width_rate, :spacing
          
      41. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    41. 
            
            

            

            
          
      42. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    42. 
            
            

            

                def initialize(data)
          
      43. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    43. 
            
            

            

                  self.data = data
          
      44. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    44. 
            
            

            

                  raise ArgumentError, 'data not valid' unless valid?
          
      45. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    45. 
            
            

            

            
          
      46. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    46. 
            
            

            

                  self.black_narrow_width = BLACK_NARROW_WIDTH
          
      47. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    47. 
            
            

            

                  self.white_narrow_width = WHITE_NARROW_WIDTH
          
      48. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    48. 
            
            

            

                  self.wide_width_rate = WIDE_WIDTH_RATE
          
      49. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    49. 
            
            

            

                  self.spacing = SPACING
          
      50. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    50. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      51. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    51. 
            
            

            

            
          
      52. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    52. 
            
            

            

                def encoding
          
      53. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    53. 
            
            

            

                  data.chars.map{|c| binary_to_bars(CHARACTER_TO_BINARY[c]) }.join(ZERO * spacing)
          
      54. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    54. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      55. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    55. 
            
            

            

            
          
      56. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    56. 
            
            

            

                def valid?
          
      57. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    57. 
            
            

            

                  data =~ FORMAT
          
      58. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    58. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      59. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    59. 
            
            

            

            
          
      60. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    60. 
            
            

            

                private
          
      61. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    61. 
            
            

            

                def binary_to_bars(bin)
          
      62. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    62. 
            
            

            

                  bin.chars.each_with_index.map{|c, i|
          
      63. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    63. 
            
            

            

                    black = i % 2 == 0
          
      64. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    64. 
            
            

            

                    narrow = c == ZERO
          
      65. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    65. 
            
            

            

            
          
      66. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    66. 
            
            

            

                    if black
          
      67. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    67. 
            
            

            

                      if narrow
          
      68. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    68. 
            
            

            

                        ONE * black_narrow_width
          
      69. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    69. 
            
            

            

                      else
          
      70. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    70. 
            
            

            

                        ONE * (black_narrow_width * wide_width_rate).to_i
          
      71. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    71. 
            
            

            

                      end
          
      72. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    72. 
            
            

            

                    else
          
      73. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    73. 
            
            

            

                      if narrow
          
      74. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    74. 
            
            

            

                        ZERO * white_narrow_width
          
      75. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    75. 
            
            

            

                      else
          
      76. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    76. 
            
            

            

                        ZERO * (white_narrow_width * wide_width_rate).to_i
          
      77. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    77. 
            
            

            

                      end
          
      78. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    78. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      79. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    79. 
            
            

            

                  }.join
          
      80. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    80. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      81. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    81. 
            
            

            

              end
          
      82. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    82. 
            
            

            

            end
          
      83.

    lib/barby/barcode/code_128.rb

    0.0% lines covered

    392 relevant lines. 0 lines covered and 392 lines missed.

              #Code 128 barcodes
          
      8. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    8. 
            
            

            

              #
          
      9. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    9. 
            
            

            

              #Note that you must provide a type for each object, either by passing a string
          
      10. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    10. 
            
            

            

              #as a second parameter to Code128.new or by instantiating one of the child classes.
          
      11. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    11. 
            
            

            

              #
          
      12.

              #You can switch type by using the CODEA, CODEB and CODEC characters:

    13. 
            
            

            

              #
          
      14. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    14. 
            
            

            

              # "\305" => A

              # "\306" => B

    16. 
            
            

            

              # "\307" => C

    17. 
            
            

            

              #
          
      18. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    18. 
            
            

            

              #As an example, here's one that starts out as type A and then switches to B and then C:

                VALUES = {

                  'A' => {
